rating_criteria.description: Knee conditions can be rated under multiple diagnostic codes simultaneously

levels.criteria: Flexion limited to 60 degrees or better
Extension limited to 5 degrees or better

instability.note: Can be rated in addition to limitation of motion if both are present

cartilage_semilunar_dislocated.criteria: Dislocated semilunar cartilage with frequent episodes of locking, pain, and effusion into the joint

levels.criteria: Favorable angle in full extension, or in slight flexion between 0 and 10 degrees
Extremely unfavorable, in flexion at an angle of 45 degrees or more
For 1 year following implantation of prosthesis
With chronic residuals consisting of severe painful motion or weakness
Minimum rating after 1 year with intermediate degrees of residual weakness, pain, or limitation of motion
Malunion with slight knee or ankle disability
Malunion with moderate knee or ankle disability
Malunion with marked knee or ankle disability
Nonunion with loose motion, requiring brace

genu_recurvatum.criteria: Acquired, traumatic genu recurvatum with weakness and insecurity in weight-bearing objectively demonstrated

exam_sections: Range of Motion (ROM) and Functional Limitation

rom_testing.contralateral_joint: Must test opposite knee unless contraindicated

pyramid_rating_note.description: Knee conditions CAN receive multiple ratings under different codes
examples: Arthritis with limited motion (5003/5260/5261) PLUS instability (5257)
Limited flexion (5260) AND limited extension (5261) can be rated separately
Meniscus condition (5258/5259) can be combined with other knee ratings
pyramid_rating_note.key_case: VAOPGCPREC 23-97: Veteran can receive separate ratings for arthritis with limitation of motion AND instability of the same knee

tips_for_veterans: Describe your WORST days, not average days
Report ALL symptoms: pain, swelling, giving way, locking, clicking
Mention if your knee gives out or feels unstable
Document any episodes where knee locks or catches
If you use a brace or cane, tell the examiner
Describe how knee affects walking, stairs, squatting, kneeling
Mention if symptoms are worse with weather changes
Report any swelling or effusion (fluid in joint)
Don't push through pain during ROM testing
Ask examiner to test both flexion AND extension limitations
Request stability testing even if not prompted
common_mistakes: Not mentioning instability symptoms (can be rated separately)
Not documenting use of assistive devices
Failing to report how condition affects work and daily activities
Not mentioning if knee swells regularly
important_notes: Limitation of flexion AND extension can be rated separately
Instability can be rated IN ADDITION to arthritis/limited motion
Both knees should be examined even if only one is claimed
Painful motion with arthritis warrants at least a 10% rating
Examiner must estimate ROM during flare-ups
Meniscus symptoms may warrant separate rating
